overview: sets the base styles for the page (e.g. reset or normalize)

param.name: $exclude
param.description: the list of styles to exlcude @see _normalize.scss and _reset.scss

param.name: $force
param.description: force reset to invoke; by default base() can only be invoked once, to re-invoke must pass in $force: true

overview: hybrid method for reset using both a global reset as well as some normalize features

param.name: $exclude
param.description: the list of features to exclude from the reset [text-adjust|links|typography|images]

overview: normalize reset

param.name: $exclude
param.description: the list of features to exclude from the reset [html5|page|links|typography|quotes|lists|embeds|figures|forms|tables|ime]

overview: leverage the Compass reset functions
this is an adaptation of global-reset()

param.name: $exclude
param.description: the list of features to exclude from the reset [html5|page|lists|typography|quotes|embeds|quotes|ime]

overview: hack to support negative margins in legacy IE
max-height hack
max-width hack
generic max-* hack wrapper
computes the border position to use

param.name: $direction
param.description: the direction the arrow is pointing (top, left, top left, etc)

return.description: the computed border position (e.g. top, left, bottom)

overview: computes the border width for the triangle

param.name: $direction
param.description: the direction the arrow is pointing (top, left, top left, etc)

overview: generates a cross-browser triangle using borders

param.name: $direction
param.description: the direction the arrow is pointing (top, left, top left, etc)

overview: positions the parent element for centered-box
makes your element centered vertically and horizontally in a parent element
calculate the width of a grid block

param.name: $columns
param.description: the number or fraction of columns to span, if fraction, must specify $of

param.name: $of
param.description: the total number of columns spanned, only use with fractional $columns

param.name: $indent
param.description: total indent for both left and right sides (needed to adjust for box-model padding)

usage: _getGridWidth(5, $indent: (10px 0px)) => subtracts the $indent from the total width

overview: abstract function to indent or outdent a grid block

param.name: $left
param.description: the number of units to dent left

param.name: $right
param.description: the number of units to dent right

overview: calculate indents on a grid block

param.name: $left
param.description: the number of units to indent left

param.name: $right
param.description: the number of units to indent right

overview: generate the negative margins needed for a grid-outdent

param.name: $left
param.description: the number of units to outdent left

param.name: $right
param.description: the number of units to outdent right

overview: calculate offsets for a grid block

param.name: $left
param.description: the number of columns to offset left

param.name: $right
param.description: the number of columns to offset right

param.name: $of
param.description: the total number of columns, used if $left/$right are fractional

overview: calculate pull (offset) for a grid block

param.name: $columns
param.description: the number of columns to offset right

param.name: $of
param.description: the total number of columns, used if $right is fractional

overview: this makes it possible to undo $first: true
this makes it possible to force a non first-column to behave as a first-column
given a set of values, output the left and right properties

param.name: $property
param.description: prefix [margin|padding|border|etc] if false, no prefix is used

param.name: $values
param.description: the list of values to output e.g. (10px 5px). if only one value (10px), it's used for both left and right

param.name: $ignore
param.description: list of values to ignore, @see if-set

overview: this lets rows clear the floated containers
output the block methods
convenience method for creating a grid canvas, @see grid

param.name: $columns
param.description: the number or fraction of columns to span, if fraction, must specify $of

param.name: $of
param.description: the total number of columns spanned, only use with fractional $columns

overview: the main grid mixin

param.name: $columns
param.description: the number or fraction of columns to span, if fraction, must specify $of

param.name: $first
param.description: is this the first grid block of a row

param.name: $of
param.description: the total number of columns spanned, only use with fractional $columns

param.name: $offset
param.description: the grid offsets @see grid-offset, grid-push, grid-pull

param.name: $canvas
param.description: treat this grid block as a canvas; a canvas is a non-floated, centered grid-block

overview: interface for the styleguide references

param.name: $strict
param.description: if true, will return only the minimal styles associated with the element (minimal inheritance)

overview: interface for the styleguide references

param.name: $is
param.description: a descriptive definition of the element, must contain an ID and optionally any modifiers e.g. large primary-button

overview: check if debug is enabled

return.description: whether or not debug is enabled

overview: a debug helper, print out a message
a debug helper, draws a "border" around the container when hovered and change opacity

param.name: $color
param.description: the color to draw the border

overview: augment the direction
test if the current user's locale matches a bucket
return: false if not found, otherwise index of $CONFIG_LOCALE;

overview: treats a list cyclically (never out of bounds, just wraps around)

return.description: the nth item in the List

overview: a math helper function to augment lists
an addition wrapper for list-math()
an subtraction wrapper for list-math()
an multiplication wrapper for list-math()
an division wrapper for list-math()
remove an index from a list
replace an index in a list

param.name: $value
param.description: the value to replace (if nil, it's a removal)

overview: extend a key-value paired list with another

param.name: $keep
param.description: a list of keys to keep in the event of a collision

param.name: $persist
param.description: if true, keys that have a non-nil value are persisted if a nil value tries to override it

overview: find a key within a nested list of ordered pairs
reverse order a list
collapse a list, effectively replacing spaces with a symbol
typecast a data element into a list

param.name: $value
param.description: the list or value to typecast

overview: map collection items to conform to a well defined collection
this is primarily used to convert shorthand notations into symmetrical longhand notations

param.name: $min
param.description: the minimum length of the collection

overview: find if any set of values is in an array (list)
this is similar to index(), but allows $values to contain multiple values to test

return.description: if an item is found, returns the index, otherwise returns false

if: (in-array(5 4 3 2, 1 1 1 4) => 2 (the index of $list where a match was found)

overview: simplify checking if a value is defined before outputting it to a property

param.name: $value
param.description: a valid css value for property

usage: =if-set(margin, $margin, $ignore: (5px, 10px)); // will only output margin if it is not 5px or 10px

overview: a function to prevent multiple imports from executing

return.description: true if the first instance of the file, false if the file has already been imported

overview: function retrieve the style for a given state allowing minimal inheritance

param.name: $states
param.description: the list of available states to inherit from

overview: given a list of browsers and versions, this will consolidate them into a
normalized list of targetted browsers

param.name: $using
param.description: an optional string to append to the end of each item

param.name: $vendors
param.description: the list of supported vendors for class targeting

return.name: $list
return.description: the normalized list of targeted browsers

usage: _getTargetedBrowsers(ie 6, $using: '&') => (.ie.ie6&) // e.g. for merging with other selectors

overview: mixin to target a specific browser using either class names or hacks
TODO: implement @content when Sass 3.2 is integrated

param.name: $browsers
param.description: the List of browsers to target

param.name: $merge
param.description: should the class name be merged e.g. `.ie8.example` vs `.ie8 .example`

overview: this is a proxy for output-style
we need this to prevent Sass from throwing an error as you currently can't use recursive mixins :/
output a property or augment it to use a mixin
convert a list of key-value pairs into CSS rules

param.name: $states
param.description: if true, output all states; if false, output no states; if a list, output only the states in the list

overview: mixin for outputting filters in legacy IE

param.name: $value
param.description: a set of filters to output, sans `progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft` prefix

overview: mixin for generating a pseudo-element
Note IE7/6 doesn't understand pseudo element as ::before and ::after
IE8 need to have :before and not ::before
this is a helper for simple gradients when a direction is desired in degrees,
but we still want to support old webkit browsers
abstract rhythm calculations
generate the horizontal rhythm offset

param.name: $left
param.description: the units to offset from the top

param.name: $right
param.description: the units to offset from the bottom

overview: generate the vertical rhythm offset

param.name: $top
param.description: the units to offset from the top

param.name: $bottom
param.description: the units to offset from the bottom

overview: generate the rhythm output
abstract factor of measurement
tries to strip off any units on a number

param.name: $number
param.description: a number with or without units
